The household entity represents a group of consumers that usually share a common address and use services as a group.

Selected Answer: D
Answer: D. Group of consumers that usually share a common address and use services as a group

Explanation: "A household has an address and consumers have their own addresses. These addresses do not need to be the same in order to add a consumer as a member to a household."

Source: https://docs.servicenow.com/en-US/bundle/tokyo-customer-service-management/page/product/customer-service-management/reference/industry-data-model-households.html

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: ACD
Configuring the assignment workbench
The assignment workbench configuration is stored in a matching rule that is based on the Selection criteria matching type. The default configuration uses the Recommendation for Case Assignment matching rule, which includes three of the four default matching criteria:
Availability Today
Matching Skills
Assigned Cases

Source: https://docs.servicenow.com/bundle/washingtondc-customer-service-management/page/product/customer-service-management/concept/case-assignment-workbench.html

Selected Answer: ACD
ACD is correct.
